category: Competition registration regulations/Article 20 (Registration qualifications and scope)
contents: Article 20 (Registration Qualifications and Scope) ① For group sports at the university level, group registration by mixing students from each school under Article 18 (3) is prohibited, and even if they are from the same foundation or a school within the same premises, they may be registered as a group. I can't. ② If a person with a history of registration for professional sports purposes is on leave of absence or studying abroad, he/she cannot register during the relevant period. However, in the following cases, member sport organizations may make separate decisions regarding registration. 1. For national team player activities at each level 2. When it is deemed necessary to develop players in particular ③ Athletes belonging to unauthorized schools and vocational schools must register according to registration classification, excluding university departments in Article 18, and graduate schools and lifelong education centers. Affiliated players register as general division. However, education and training facilities that have received evaluation and recognition from universities in accordance with the Act on Credit Recognition, etc. may be determined separately depending on the member sports organization. ④ If a person with a history of registration for professional sports purposes is serving as an active-duty soldier (including military and transitional service), he or she cannot register as an athlete for a college or workplace athletics department, and cannot register for recreational sports purposes. However, social workers may register with an organization assigned by the Military Manpower Administration. Revised 2023. 2. 10. ⑤ Graduate school students and players over 19 years of age who are not students (excluding Paragraph 6) are registered in the general division. Revised 2022. 1. 24., 2023. 5. 4. ⑥ If an athlete under the age of 18 enters college while working at the workplace athletics department, he or she will be registered as a general player, notwithstanding Article 18 (3) and (4). However, after the contract with the workplace athletics department expires while attending college, you can change your registration to the university department. Revised May 4, 2023
